page.title: 05RECREATION ON BUTSER HILL
page.content: This is an ideal place for kite flying because of the open spaces, hills and upcurrents of air.Radio controlled model aircraft and gliders are flown. Hang gliders take off from the summit of the escarpment and can be seen floating over the area.Pony trekking expeditions are arranged each weekend and on summer evenings, taking in visits to local inns.Grass ski_ing,now an internatioal sport is becoming very popular.For the experienced, the ski club has a lift to the higher slopes. Grass skis look very different from the long snow skis and are like large boots set on caterpillar wheels. High speeds can be reached on them.In the winter months, if snow has fallen, the conventional skiers and tobogganers appear on the slopes.Many visitors while away their leisure time watching others pursuing these pastimes.
